name: Modern private 2 bedrooms apt minutes to NYC
neighborhood_overview:
Our House is located in the Liberty State Park neighborhood and you are invited to enjoy the private large two bedrooms apartment on second floor .The kitchen is completely new and is fully supplied with dishes and cookware, and has a gas range, stainless steel refrigerator, granite counter top, microwave and dishwasher. Fresh bedding linens and towels are included.

There is also free street parking for those with a car.

Location is great. Just 25 - 40 minutes by convenient public transportation to Manhattan and just 10 minutes by car. Walking distance to Liberty State Park with beautiful views of Manhattan, there is recreation area, jogging paths, playground, barbecue areas, Science Museum and the ferry to Ellis Island and the Statue of Liberty.

There is 10- 15 minutes walk from historic downtown Jersey City with trendy restaurants, bars, and shops. From there you can take the PATH subway to Manhattan (2 stops to the World Trade Center or 4-5 stops

name: Room & Private Bath~Minutes to NYC!
neighborhood_overview:
Downtown Jersey City is right outside of Manhattan, and has great restaurants, bars, and shops all within walking distance. There are parks nearby as well. If you walk 10 minutes to the waterfront you will get spectacular views of Manhattan. A large shopping mall and grocery store are also a couple blocks away. I have lived here over 15 years and feel very safe.

Other local attractions include Hoboken and Liberty State Park which has ferry service to the Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, and Manhattan.

name: Spacious Studio minutes away from NYC
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is seconds from "Little India", which offers low-budget to formal Indian dining, in addition to Filipino, Latin American, and Egyptian cuisine, reflecting the city's wide ethnic population. Downtown Jersey City is also minutes away and offers a big variety of Bars and Restaurants.

Jersey City is just across the Hudson river, and it's closer and better connected to the heart of Manhattan than some boroughs and locations in New York City. It is literally 10 minutes away from Downtown Manhattan by subway (path train) and 15mn away from Greenwich Village and midtown. The Path Train runs all day and all night on a schedule.

name: New apt in downtown JC minutes away from Manhattan
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is safe and trendy. It’s a great neighborhood for New York City commuters and travelers as well as for those that want to enjoy a bit more calmness than Manhattan while being minutes away from it.

Aside from the proximity to the underground transportation with Manhattan and other parts of New Jersey, you will have in less than 5 minutes walk a large diversity of exciting cafes, restaurants, bars, shops, yoga studios, gyms and a great supermarket (Keyfood).

In less than 15 minutes walk you will reach a large shopping mall, a multiplex movie theater, several parks, and the riverside with some of the best views in the New York Metropolitan Area. If you want more shopping, next to the Newport Mall, you can find Shoprite, BJ’S Wholesale, Bed Bath & Beyond, The Home Depot and Target.

name: Nice Apt -10 minutes to Manhattan
neighborhood_overview:
Mercer Street is in the heart of Historic Downtown/Van Vorst areas of Jersey City anchored by the Grove Street PATH station. When not exploring Manhattan, there is much to do in Jersey City. These include:
* walking along the Hudson River Waterfront for great views of Manhattan or venturing over to Hoboken for the great bar scene
* checking out the great restaurants in the area
* visiting massive Liberty State Park which has ferry service to Ellis Island and the Statue of Liberty
* taking the kids to the Liberty Science Center
* attending the Farmers' Market or the live music performances at Grove Square: http://www.jcdowntown.org/
* shopping at the Newport Center Mall or the local boutiques scattered on Grove Street or finding a bargain at the flea market on Saturday's at Van Vorst Park

name: Luxury Furnished 1 Bedroom Apartment Jersey City
neighborhood_overview:
Why stay in Manhattan when you can savor the peace and quiet of this luxurious Jersey City high-rise? Away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and Fifth Avenue, this Downtown Jersey City building is a better value than anything you’d find across the Hudson - and you can still get to NYC in minutes via the ferry or the PATH train.

Rest and relax in this peaceful oasis perched on the edge of the river, which features plush mattresses, sophisticated wood furnishings, and spacious closets so you can unpack and stay for a while. In the bathroom, you’ll find masterful tile work and modern fixtures - plus towels and toiletries provided for your convenience.

After a day at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, a matinee show on Broadway, or a packed agenda of meetings, you’re bound to be hungry, Cook up a storm in the full kitchen, which features stainless steel appliances, including a full-size fridge and freezer, an electric stove, an oven, a microwave, and a dishwashe

name: DWTN Jersey City Art Studio Apt, long term stays
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City is exploding with new restaurants, high rises, and notoriety ... it is the new hot spot to live in the NYC metro area. You will find one of the best restaurants (Madame Claude's) one block from my place, but there are lots of great bars and restaurants nearby.

RESTAURANTS/BARS:
Madame Claude's - amazing French food, killer brunch, fantastic Parisian music Thursday nights ... get a reservation. (1 min. walk)
Cellar 335 - very cool spot, global eats, tiki themed (1 min)
White Star - local dive bar w/solid food (3 min.)
Porta - great pizza (10 min.)
Taqueria - best Mexican food around, great fish/pork tacos (13 min.)
Talde - pricey, but memorable (10 min.)
Mathews - upscale, menu for everyone (12 min.)
Ibby's Falafel - great falafel sandwich (14 min.)
Pet Shop - used to be local pet shop, now it's a bar (8 min.)
Dullboy - cocktail lounge hip w/NYC vibe (12 min.)
BeClaws - if you want seafood (7 min

name: 2B/2Ba Maximalist Apt Close 2NYC
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights is enchanting newcomers for its charm, strong sense of community and thriving local business scene.

The Heights overlooks Hoboken from the Palisades, and because Hoboken is a historic district with height restrictions there are no high rises affording the Heights protected NYC views. Central Avenue and Palisade Avenue boast immaculate Manhattan skyline and Hudson River vistas.

Jersey City Heights retains the feeling of a small town and is very walkable. I would describe the Heights as youthful, energetic and extremely diverse.

name: Dr Norton House@Lincoln Park JC,NJ
neighborhood_overview:
It is one mile from the Journal Square transportation center (JSQ on the PATH line). From JSQ, you can take the PATH to Newark and catch the NJ Transit trains. You can also go to Hoboken, World Trade Center or take the 33rd Street line to Greenwich Village or uptown. It takes less than one hour to get to 33rd St via PATH. There is a bus stop right on the corner about 100 feet away. From there, you can get the bus to JSQ or directly into Port Authority in NYC, which puts you right near Times Square and the theater district. The bus to Port Authority usually takes 45-60 minutes. We are one block from Lincoln Park, which offers great walks and opportunities to work out, including jogging paths and a track.
We are 5 blocks from St. Peter's University, 1.5 miles to NJCU and a mile from Hudson County Community College.
We are also very close to Liberty State Park, which is one of the most visited state parks in the country! You can get a ferry to the Statue of Liberty or Ellis Is

name: (A) At the foot of the Statute
neighborhood_overview:
- Not a greatest neighborhood in Jersey City. We are one Light Rail stop off from the most developed/expensive part of JC (and the contrast is quite clear). You will notice graffiti as well as bars covering the windows (but the crime rate is not at all high compared to surrounding area including downtown JC based on public statistics). Some of our guests were not comfortable being in the neighborhood and it took for our family to get used to it.
- The neighborhood could be noisy due to freight railway that passes nearby and a neighbor who plays loud music outside every few Saturday.
- Limited supermarkets and restaurants availability (a few small convenient stores in the neighborhood but, for a decent supermaket, you will have to take light rail to Hudson Greene Market near Exchange Place station.)

name: Legal historic home 7 min train to NYC with yard
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

This city is full of history and quaint restaurants and bars that earned it its nickname as “The Wall Street West”. The historic downtown has many million-dollar brownstones and row houses filled with charming historical 1800’s characteristics. Jersey City just recently spent 7 million dollars upgrading its main upscare pedestrian walkway downtown area with all stores and restaurants. A super fast commute to NYC with many restaurants and boutiques: walk to the subway and ride just 5 minutes to NYC World Trade Center.

The house, built in 1856, is located in Downtown Jersey City with a lot to offer: Cafés, Restaurants ( Orale - Mexican cuisine Razza Pizza), Bars (Dullboy, The Ashford), Pharmacies ( CVS, Walgreens, Medly), and just minutes to Hudson River Waterfront Walkway (walk along the water and enjoy stunning views of NYC). Reserve your seat at the Wally Wall, Manhattan Yacht Club's floating clubhouse in the harbor.

name: Historic District - Doctor's Row Renovated Flat
neighborhood_overview:
Beautiful Lincoln Park is only a half block away and is part of the newly designated historic district. The park boasts river-front views, a 9-hole golf course, tennis courts, bird sanctuary, and a grand fountain recently restored to its original glory (designed by Pierre J. Cheron, it is the world's largest concrete monument!).
There are many great restaurants in Jersey City, along with farmers' markets and easy access to grocery and other shopping. Restaurant recommendations will be provided on your arrival, along with local transportation info and other helpful tips.

name: Cozy red studio 15 min walk to JSQ path station
neighborhood_overview:
This is a cosmopolitan neighborhood. The Journal Square Path Station (Jersey City-Hoboken's subway system that connects us to Manhattan) is only 15 min walking distance away. We are very close to downtown Jersey City where you can find fancy restaurants and bars. Hoboken is also close by. Uber and the Citibike are affordable options to go to the Path Station and downtown, even to Hoboken. This studio is close to Manhattan and offers great value for those venturing into the city. If you are from the suburbs or small cities of the US with no traffic, no crowds, be prepared for big city life. It’s a safe neighborhood. My family and I have lived in this neighborhood for almost two decades. None of my tenants, guests or neighbors have had an issue about safety.
If you want a good value for your money, this is the right place for you!
STREET PARKING: If you are planning to come with a car, you're lucky if you can find a spot on the street. Jersey City is a highly populated city

name: Plush 1BR Near Statue of Liberty
neighborhood_overview:
Why stay in Manhattan when you can savor the peace and quiet of this luxurious Jersey City high-rise? Away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and Fifth Avenue, this Downtown Jersey City building is a better value than anything you’d find across the Hudson - and you can still get to NYC in minutes via the ferry or the PATH train.

Rest and relax in this peaceful oasis perched on the edge of the river, which features plush mattresses, sophisticated wood furnishings, and spacious closets so you can unpack and stay for a while. In the bathroom, you’ll find masterful tile work and modern fixtures - plus towels and toiletries provided for your convenience.

After a day at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, a matinee show on Broadway, or a packed agenda of meetings, you’re bound to be hungry, Cook up a storm in the full kitchen, which features stainless steel appliances, including a full-size fridge and freezer, an electric stove, an oven, a microwave, and a dishwashe

name: Chic & Modern 1 bedroom, near New York City - NYC
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled in a vibrant Jersey City neighborhood, our chic apartment offers easy access to New York City, just a 15-minute subway ride or car journey away. The lively Pedestrian Plaza, a 5-minute walk, boasts an array of restaurants, bars, nightlife, and shops. Green spaces, a grocery store, and coffee shops are also within 2 minute walking distance. With its unique blend of city life, local charm, historic architecture, and diverse culture, this neighborhood provides the perfect base for exploring Jersey City and NYC, all within walking reach.

name: Warm, Snug, Cozy space  3 blocks PATH train $50
neighborhood_overview:
Downtown Jersey City is a vibrant and diverse community of neighborhoods. Lots of restaurants and drinking establishments and food shops. Citi Bike stands are only a few blocks away in any direction from the house.

With the PATH train only a few blocks away, access into NYC is on a 24/7 basis. Both uptown to 33rd St and downtown to WTC.

On-street parking: No Parking for non-residents from 8:30am to 5pm daily. OK for weekends. Even with a parking permit, parking is very limited. There is alternative street cleaning.

Experience Jersey City's own culture, character and community, while having the option to commute into NYC in under 30-minutes via the PATH. With its proximity to Manhattan, Jersey City is popular among young professionals working in New York City looking for an alternative to living in one of the five boroughs. Downtown Jersey City, a major historical district, overlooks the Manhattan skyline. You'll find a vast array of food options from Korean, Indian, and Cuban as well as Italian Street Festivals.

Journal Square is a melting pot of cultures, offering a vibrant tapestry of ethnic diversity. This is reflected in the variety of cuisines, shops, and markets found throughout the neighborhood. name: Large studio w/workspace & garden-2 stops to NYC
neighborhood_overview:
Historic Downtown Jersey City is brimming with activity! With its close proximity to NYC, the area has seen a rapid development in the past 7 years and is now home to a diverse mix of locals, restaurants, bars and businesses. Just take a look on Yelp and you will find over 50 places to eat and drink at that are rated 4 STARS and above, all within a 10 minute walk from the apartment! In addition, there is Newport Mall nearby, which has a lot of shopping options (H&M, Zara, Coach, G-Star, Macys, Footlocker to name a few) a cinema and a diverse food court.

In our opinion, there are only 3 areas in New Jersey that are worth staying in if you are visiting NYC for a vacation or for business. Downtown Jersey City, Historic Jersey City and Hoboken due to their transport links to Manhattan, great local bars and restaurants, and for being known as incredibly safe areas.

name: Chic Large Family home! Quick train or bus to NYC!
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City is a gem with the best view of the Manhattan skyline and a 7 min drive to the Statue of Liberty! Hoboken, home of Carlo's Bakery, is our next door neighbor. We are also close to Liberty State Park, where you can catch a ferry to the Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, or to NYC!

name: Stylish Apt 40 mins from NYC - TV/Laundry/Parking
neighborhood_overview:
Bergen-Lafayette is an urban neighborhood offering a diverse mix of residents, sights, and activities. This is a decent neighborhood and is generally safe. Please remember you are in Jersey City, not all of its streets are lined with charming brownstones and upscale restaurants. Some blocks, like ours, will give you extra entertainment in the form of the occasional loud boombox or kids playing lively games of hide and seek on the street.

Uber is very popular in Jersey City, and a ride between the apartment and the PATH station at Exchange Place in Downtown won't cost more than $10. They will take a group of 4 people, which means your cost per-person will be lower than the $2.5 light rail ticket. If you haven't used Uber before, let me know and I will send you an invite which comes with a small discount.

name: Renovated, Modern 1BR Apt in Prime Location
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in the historic neighborhood of Hamilton Park in downtown Jersey City. The apartment is two blocks away from the park, which has tennis courts, a basketball court, a large playground, plenty of tree-shaded grassy areas for a picnic, and a farmer’s market on Wednesdays from May through November.

Newark Avenue, a pedestrian-only street with lots of trendy restaurants and bars, is an 8-minute walk away.

The Newport Mall, with plenty of shopping options and a large movie theater, is three blocks away.

There are a number of restaurants, as well as some great ice cream shops and several local coffee shops, within close walking distance. There are also two grocery stores located within five blocks of the apartment (ShopRite and Key Food).

Why stay in Manhattan when you can savor the peace and quiet of this luxurious Jersey City high-rise? Away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and Fifth Avenue, this Downtown Jersey City building is a better value than anything you’d find across the Hudson - and you can still get to NYC in minutes via the ferry or the PATH train.

Rest and relax in this peaceful oasis perched on the edge of the river, which features plush mattresses, sophisticated wood furnishings, and spacious closets so you can unpack and stay for a while. In the bathroom, you’ll find masterful tile work and modern fixtures - plus towels and toiletries provided for your convenience.

name: Spacious 4BR home 30 mins* from NY! Parking avail!
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City is close to NYC and has a variety of public transportation options. Neighboring Hoboken and downtown Jersey City are both easy 15 minute walks and have plenty of lovely options for dining and entertainment. 20 minutes from Newark airport.

We are 6 miles from MetLife stadium, home to the Giants and Jets. Appr. 15 minutes via Uber or car.

We provide maps and bus/train instructions for NYC travel. The fastest to Herald Square (Macys's) is (a) 16 min walk to PATH at Journal Square, then 20 min train to 33rd street. Or take 3 minute bus to PATH for faster service. PATH drops at Christopher Street, 9th street, 14th street (Union Square), 23rd street and 33rd street (Macy's). There is also a separate Path Service line directly to the World Trade Center (about 10 minutes on the train).

There are also direct buses that get you to Times Square (Port Authority) in about 35 to 45 minutes that pickup directly outside of our street.

name: ⭐Minutes to NYC⭐ Brownstone beauty | FREE PARKING
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is very safe and family friendly. Like NYC, the neighborhood is cultural diversity. Jersey City has been gentrifying for the last few years.  We have seen an influx of young professionals and families like ourselves move into this beautiful, vibrant city. We have lived in Jersey City for nine years with our three young kids (6,8,10) and Tim's family has been here for 100+ years.

A couple of blocks from us is an elementary school, catholic high school, Saint Peter's University, churches, and the New Jersey National Guard Armory.

There is a grocery store, wine shop, diners/restaurants right around the corner. One of the best bagel places in the NYC/NJ area is just a few blocks away. An amazing local favorite breakfast spot, Cafe Alice is a block from us. Little India, a 15-minute walk away, has some of the best restaurants around and there are plenty of dining options closer to Journal Square.

name: 72 "1" Bright Room by light rail/bus to NYC/WIFI
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood has experienced a revitalization, with new businesses, restaurants, and cultural venues sprouting up. Local entrepreneurs have opened trendy coffee shops, art galleries, and boutiques, adding to the neighborhood's vibrancy. This blend of old and new creates a dynamic and evolving landscape that appeals to both longtime residents and newcomers alike.
Bergen-Lafayette also boasts a thriving food scene, with an array of culinary options reflecting the diverse cultural influences present in the area. You can find everything from traditional soul food to global cuisine, making it a destination for food lovers seeking unique dining experiences.

The neighborhood's green spaces are another highlight. Berry Lane Park, a large and beautifully designed public park, provides a tranquil oasis where residents can enjoy outdoor activities, picnics, and community gatherings. It serves as a hub for recreational opportunities and offers a respite from the bustling city.<

name: The Cook's Brickhouse *Walk to PATH!
neighborhood_overview:
Check out my guidebook for recommendations!
The Journal Square area is old and gaining ground with occasional classic films playing at the historic Loews Theater across from the Path Station.
•The Mana Contemporary Art Center is around the corner.
•Square 1 Community cafe is 2 doors down serving excellent food and coffees, drinks etc.
•Little India is a block away with shopping, fresh food, butchers and excellent restaurants.
•Convenience stores like the Dollar Store, a liquor store and small ethnic markets are easily available. There are ashrams as well and a yoga studio.
•Grove Street (Path station stop) is chock full of new restaurants that are delicious and now pedestrian in some areas. Shops and nightlife abound if you decide to stay in Jersey City. Jivamukti has an excellent yoga studio there as well.
•Exchange Place (Path station) has a direct ferry to Brookside Place (near WTC and the Oculus).

name: Urban Sanctuary: 1 Stop To NYC, 2 BR w Cool Yard
neighborhood_overview:
We love our neighborhood for the perfect balance of walkability, diversity, and livability. Smart travelers already know Downtown Jersey City is closer to Manhattan than 95% of Queens and Brooklyn with considerably less crowds. Plus our mayor is young and progressive and fully legalized airbnb in 2015, unlike NYC where is very much illegal for short term rentals. Our waterfront has one of the most picturesque views of lower Manhattan, New York Harbor and Statue of Liberty.

The apartment is two short blocks away from Hamilton Park surrounded by gorgeous brownstones and 19th century rowhouses, and it is adorned with impressive 100+ year old trees and lush glass within that often serve as gathering place for locals and visitors alike - the park hosts weekly farmers market, seasonal movie screenings, barbecue festivals, tennis and basketball courts, just to name a few.

name: Lovely private bed/bath Paulus Hook, Jersey City
neighborhood_overview:
We love the Paulus Hook neighborhood. We are five blocks from the Hudson River! The Freedom Tower in lower Manhattan is visible to the east as you stand in front of our house. There are convenient coffee and breakfast places just a couple of blocks away. I highly recommend the Light Horse Tavern, Amelia's, Taqueria, and Sam a.m. (for breakfast), four of many great restaurants within a few blocks of our house.

Practically anything you want is really less than a 15 minute walk away! More excellent restaurants for foodies, specialty grocery stores, bakeries, live music, etc. I'm happy to provide recommendations for any activity or shopping need you may have.

name: 3 bed 2.5 bath + 1 Parking! Home away from Home
neighborhood_overview:
Our property is a 7 minute walk to the Grove Street PATH train station which provides transportation to New York City, Newark Airport, Hoboken, etc. Depending on your destination, it is an approximately 10-20 minutes commute on the PATH train to Manhattan.

Jersey City is a melting pot of international influences from its residents to its varied and appetizing culinary options - Korean, Indian, Filipino, Cuban, Italian, and American.

The Statue of Liberty and Ellis Islands are less than ½ mile away from Liberty State Park’s ferry dock. Liberty Science Center is a 10 minutes drive from Urban Base Camp. There are beautiful green spaces - Hamilton Park, Van Vorst Park, and Liberty Park - where kids can frolic and play, where you can walk, run, and cycle, take a picnic and gaze upon Manhattan’s skyline. The Newport area - one stop from Grove PATH station - offers you a mall, large stores, and a beautiful waterfront walkway.

name: JC Heights 1 bd Apt+divide-room  few min to NYC
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights, often simply called The Heights, is a pleasant, somewhat densely packed residential neighborhood in the northern section of Jersey City, which in turn is the second largest city in the state of New Jersey.

Homes in the area can be most often found in the two- and three-family detached houses which sit on small lots and which dominate the housing stock here, or in the low-rise apartment buildings that also are a considerable presence in the neighborhood. There are also more than a few stately old Victorian and Edwardian houses scattered throughout the streets of the Heights with rental apartments within, especially on Sherman Place and Summit Avenue.

Rental apartments in The Heights are generally considered to be located in the area that's bordered to the south by the Bergen Arches rail tracks and The Divided Highway (also known as the Pulaski Skyway, or Route 139); to the east by Palisade Avenue (and the city of Hoboken); to the north by Patt

Jersey City Heights is a beautiful, growing artist community right above Hoboken. This luxury condo is located right in the formal Riverview Arts District and has numerous coffee places, cafes, restaurants, juice bars, and dessert places opening regularly.

Right at the corner on JFK Blvd, are regular private buses into Port Authority, New York City. These buses take about 15-20 minutes, come every few minutes, and are about $3 per person.

Also right at the corner is NJ Transit Buses which goes to Port Authority for $4.50, but you must have exact change.

NJ Transit App can be downloaded for routes and fares as well as CityMapper app.

Walk a few blocks down on Congress Street and there is the 9th Street Light Rail Station in Hoboken, you can take the rail to the path or ferry and get to Downtown or Midtown Manhattan. name: The Alana - A Chic Duplex 40 Minutes from NYC
neighborhood_overview:
While the majority of our guests come to see NYC, we urge you to explore Jersey City’s beautiful Bergen Lafayette as well. Within 10 minutes of the apartment you will find an array of hip new restaurants, bars, and cafes located on the evolving Communipaw Avenue. Grind Coffee Shop is a must if you are a coffee fan. Three blocks from the house is the new Berry Lane Park - host to regular soccer matches and tennis games. Don’t forget to visit Downtown Jersey City for local gems like Torico Ice Cream Shop and Taqueria Downtown.

Bergen-Lafayette is an urban neighborhood offering a diverse mix of residents, sights, and activities. This is a decent neighborhood and is generally safe. Please remember you are in Jersey City, not all of its streets are lined with charming brownstones and upscale restaurants. name: Lovely room for rent with shared bathroom
neighborhood_overview:
We are a Century’s old Guest/Rooming House that has been renovated. We offer European style rooms with shared bathrooms and Continental styled rooms with private bathrooms.
All rooms have microwave ovens, mini refrigerators, desk and chair, Iron, blow dryer, heat and air conditioning (in the summer and spring), sheets, comforter, towels, shampoo, conditioner, body wash, plastic utensils, plates, bowls, cups, toilet paper and free Wi-Fi.
We also have a laundry room for your use (for a fee) on premises and we will provide you with a refillable laundry card.

The property is clean, safe and secure and is located in a quiet tree-lined residential neighborhood only one block from 24 hour Journal Square ( JSQ) PATH train station. In the PATH station there is a 24 hour Deli/Café and several Deli, coffee shops and stores within walking distance as well as the local police station.

name: Breathtaking Urban Gem w/Backyard & Parking
neighborhood_overview:
Located just across the Hudson River from New York City, some refer to Jersey City as the sixth borough. Overlooking Hoboken and the Manhattan skyline, Jersey City Heights is a go-to spot for tourists.
Due to its location, one hundred feet above sea level on the western side of the Hudson River, residents get to enjoy beautiful scenic views of the Manhattan skyline from one side and beautiful marshes and meadowlands on the other side. Variety of public transportation options like the PATH Train, New Jersey Transit’s  Light Rail, and public buses make your traveling to New York City, downtown Jersey City, or Hoboken quick and convenient. Take the stairs off Paterson Plank Road to Hoboken’s 2nd Street Light Rail Station or the elevator at Congress Street to the 9th Street Light Rail Station to easily commute around Hoboken, Weehawken, Jersey City, Bayonne and beyond! New Jersey Transit bus routes also serve this neighborhood, with several major lines to help you zip around locally

name: Renovated 1 bedroom Apartment/WIFI/close to NYC
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood has experienced a revitalization, with new businesses, restaurants, and cultural venues sprouting up. Local entrepreneurs have opened trendy coffee shops, art galleries, and boutiques, adding to the neighborhood's vibrancy. This blend of old and new creates a dynamic and evolving landscape that appeals to both longtime residents and newcomers alike.
Bergen-Lafayette also boasts a thriving food scene, with an array of culinary options reflecting the diverse cultural influences present in the area. You can find everything from traditional soul food to global cuisine, making it a destination for food lovers seeking unique dining experiences.

name: Striking Modern Luxury appeal w/old world charm
neighborhood_overview:
Located just across the Hudson River from New York City, some refer to Jersey City as the sixth borough. Jersey City's Heights section exemplifies convenient, commuter friendly living in a timeless charming neighborhood! Overlooking Hoboken and the Manhattan skyline, Jersey City Heights is a go-to spot for tourists.
Due to its location, one hundred feet above sea level on the western side of the Hudson River, residents get to enjoy beautiful scenic views of the Manhattan skyline from one side and beautiful marshes and meadowlands on the other side. Variety of public transportation options like the PATH Train, New Jersey Transit’s Light Rail, and public buses make your traveling to New York City, downtown Jersey City, or Hoboken quick and convenient. Take the stairs off Paterson Plank Road to Hoboken’s 2nd Street Light Rail Station or the elevator at Congress Street to the 9th Street Light Rail Station to easily commute around Hoboken, Weehawken, Jersey City, Bayonne and beyond! name: Lavish 3BR Retreat w Private Rooftop Deck Near NYC
neighborhood_overview:
Just one-square-mile (2.5 square kilometers) in size, Hoboken is a small town with everything you love about city life. Washington Street is the main thoroughfare, lined with great restaurants, bars bistro-pubs and rooftop bars. Spend an afternoon exploring quaint cobblestone streets, where you’ll find one-of-a-kind boutiques.

Take in the stunning views of NYC as you bike or stroll along the Hudson River Waterfront Walkway, visiting parks and piers on with way. Join the free yoga class at Pier A or settle in for a movie under the stars at Pier 13 Park. Throughout the year, Hoboken hosts a wide range of concerts and a full schedule of festivals celebrating the arts and food—from Restaurant Week to The Mutz (Mozzarella) Festival. There’s a youthful energy here that’s infectious.

name: Stylish Apt with Balcony and Patio - 20 mins to NY
neighborhood_overview:
Downtown Jersey City is an excellent place to explore in its own right. Within a 15 minute walk you will find more than 30 excellent restaurants including Razza (the best Pizza in NYC, according to the NY Times), Taqueria Downtown (best tacos in NJ, according to us!) and cuisines from all over the world. We also have a thriving art scene with lots of street art; ask Kevin for tips =)
It's only a 20 min walk to the waterfront at Exchange Place where you will have jaw dropping views of Manhattan across the river; there are a few excellent dining options there as well such as Hudson & Co, Lokal JC and DomoDomo.

name: Lovely 1 Bedroom Apartment/WIFI/walk to Path/NYC
neighborhood_overview:
Journal Square is a vibrant and bustling neighborhood, known for its central transportation hub and rich cultural heritage.

At the heart of Journal Square is the Journal Square Transportation Center, a major transportation hub connecting various forms of transit, including buses, trains, and PATH (Port Authority Trans-Hudson) trains. This central location makes it a convenient hub for commuting to New York City and other parts of New Jersey, attracting a diverse range of residents and visitors.
Journal Square is a melting pot of cultures, offering a vibrant tapestry of ethnic diversity. This is reflected in the variety of cuisines, shops, and markets found throughout the neighborhood. From Indian and Middle Eastern eateries to Latin American and Caribbean flavors, there is no shortage of culinary delights to explore. You can also find an array of local shops, markets, and specialty stores that cater to diverse tastes and preferences.

name: Jersey City Pink Spot
neighborhood_overview: The JC Pink Spot is located in the center of an up-and-coming neighborhood. It is located 35/40 minutes away from NYC, which was particularly important to me. While being on a busy commercial block you will hear street traffic during your stay as we are  on the corner of a major Boulevard. We are located near various convince stores and shopping centers. neighborhood_overview: 5 mins from NYC Jersey City has a vibrant food scene and was named America's next great food city by Travel and Leisure. Each bar has a slightly different flavor (though most promise at least a beer and a bite to eat!) and every local swears loyalty to “their” beloved bar. Rising above Jersey City, the Heights boast truly spectacular views of the Manhattan skyline. As the sun sets on Riverview Fisk Park, unobstructed views allow you to take in the full splendor of the city’s lights. The Heights additionally boasts its own lush green fields in Pershing Field Park, aquatic diversions at the Reservoir, fresh adventures through the Riverview Farmers Market or strolls through the Riverview Arts District. Jersey City is the most ethnically diverse city in both New Jersey and the United States, a richness reflected in the wide array of ethnic restaurants that grace The Heights. Journal Square is a vibrant and bustling neighborhood, known for its central transportation hub and rich cultural heritage.

Journal Square is a melting pot of cultures, offering a vibrant tapestry of ethnic diversity. This is reflected in the variety of cuisines, shops, and markets found throughout the neighborhood. name: Serene Oasis - 30 mins to NYC
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to Jersey City Heights, a vibrant and diverse neighborhood that offers a unique blend of urban living and community charm. Situated atop the Palisades, this elevated neighborhood provides stunning views of the Manhattan skyline and the Hudson River.

Jersey City Heights is known for its tree-lined streets, historic brownstones, and a lively atmosphere. Explore Central Avenue, the main commercial corridor, where you'll find an array of local shops, restaurants, and cafes to satisfy your culinary cravings. From international cuisine to cozy coffee shops, there's something for every palate.

Nature enthusiasts will appreciate the neighborhood's proximity to several parks, such as Pershing Field Park, where you can enjoy green spaces, playgrounds, and sports facilities. neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights is a lively and safe neighborhood located in Jersey City, New Jersey, just across the Hudson River from Manhattan. Known for its vibrant atmosphere and scenic views, it has become a popular destination for residents and visitors alike.

One of the defining features of Jersey City Heights is its elevated location, which provides breathtaking panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline and the Hudson River. Residents and visitors can enjoy stunning vistas from various vantage points throughout the neighborhood, offering a unique perspective on the iconic New York City skyline.

The area offers a wide range of culinary options. From cozy cafes to trendy restaurants, you'll find an array of cuisines to satisfy your palate.

name: Spacious King Bed & Private Bath | 8 Mins to NYC!
neighborhood_overview:
Downtown is best known and loved for its charming historical architecture. Four of the five historic districts are Downtown where beautiful brownstones beguile along tree-lined streets in Harsimus Cove and around namesake parks in neighborhoods like Van Vorst Park and Hamilton Park.

The condo is located in the downtown section called Paulus Hook. Tucked between Exchange Place and the Colgate Clock along the Hudson River, it is one of the most sought-after historic districts. There, you can find leafy side streets dotted with restaurants, shops, and magnificent brownstones.

Downtown offers the most transportation options with three PATH trains stations and three NY Waterway ferry stops, making the commute to NYC less than 10 minutes. Buses and the Hudson-Bergen Light Rail are accessible as well. neighborhood_overview:
Given Jersey City's proximity and accessibility by rapid transit to Manhattan, Jersey City is sometimes referred to as New York City's Sixth borough. Our house is located between Jersey City's top schools - Saint Peter's University and New Jersey City University.

There’s a 24 hour 7-eleven and Walgreens 1 minute drive/6min walk from the house.

There’s a 24 hour 7-eleven and Walgreens 1 minute drive/6min walk from the house.

neighborhood_overview: JC Heights is a closely knit, ethnically diverse and bustling neighborhood. There is always a new store or pop-up-event happening, but there are many tried and true staples within a few blocks as well. The neighborhood is flanked by 2 commercial arteries, Central and Palisade Avenue, which is home to many restaurants and conveniences including bodegas, salons, dry cleaners, post-office, flower shop, dispensaries, pharmacies, Covid-testing centers, and shoes stores. Nearby Riverview and Washington Parks are the heart of outdoor life for our neighborhood with skyline views, green spaces for picnics and walks, dog parks, playgrounds, playing fields and splash pads. If we are lucky enough to host you between May and November, you can enjoy the bounties of the Riverview Farmer’s Market every Sunday and other seasonal fairs. name: Entire apartment min to NYC/King Bed/JSQ path/WIFI
neighborhood_overview:
Journal Square is a vibrant and bustling neighborhood, known for its central transportation hub and rich cultural heritage.

At the heart of Journal Square is the Journal Square Transportation Center, a major transportation hub connecting various forms of transit, including buses, trains, and PATH (Port Authority Trans-Hudson) trains. This central location makes it a convenient hub for commuting to New York City and other parts of New Jersey, attracting a diverse range of residents and visitors.
Journal Square is a melting pot of cultures, offering a vibrant tapestry of ethnic diversity. This is reflected in the variety of cuisines, shops, and markets found throughout the neighborhood. From Indian and Middle Eastern eateries to Latin American and Caribbean flavors, there is no shortage of culinary delights to explore. You can also find an array of local shops, markets, and specialty stores that cater to diverse tastes and preferences.

name: 1 bedroom Full Apartment/Near NYC/WIFI
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights is a lively and safe neighborhood located in Jersey City, New Jersey, just across the Hudson River from Manhattan. Known for its vibrant atmosphere and scenic views, it has become a popular destination for residents and visitors alike.

One of the defining features of Jersey City Heights is its elevated location, which provides breathtaking panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline and the Hudson River. Residents and visitors can enjoy stunning vistas from various vantage points throughout the neighborhood, offering a unique perspective on the iconic New York City skyline.

The area offers a wide range of culinary options. From cozy cafes to trendy restaurants, you'll find an array of cuisines to satisfy your palate.

name: JC Cozy Home 1
neighborhood_overview:
We are in Jersey City heights which is a local community that has been ranked the most diverse city in America for the past 4 years.

You can try every type of restaurant you can imagine on Central Avenue. It's not fancy, it's authentic. We have Puerto Rican, Dominican, Polish, Italian, Mexican, Indian, Vietnamese, Chinese, and Cuban.

There is a park 2 blocks away with tennis courts, basketball, workout equipment, baseball, and great walking paths.

About 10 blocks away is a beautiful view of Manhattan and New York.

name: Garden Level Apt in JC Heights
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to the Heights!
Jersey City Heights is a vibrant neighborhood in Jersey City, known for its diverse community and proximity to Manhattan.
The area is home to wonderful local bars, amazing restaurants, and cute cafes. Riverview Fisk Park offers stunning views of the Manhattan skyline, as well as a playground, a picnic area, and a dog park. Pershing Field is another great option for a leisurely stroll or a game of bocce ball.

name: New luxurious 3 BR 2.5BA Duplex W/Backyard
neighborhood_overview:
The Bergen-Lafayette section of Jersey City is home to a number of great places to eat and drink. Whether you're looking for a quick bite to eat or a sit-down meal, there's something for everyone in this vibrant neighborhood.

Some of our favorite places to eat in Bergen-Lafayette include Pinwheel Garden, Mordi's Sandwich Shop, Martha's, and Harry's Daughter. Each of these restaurants has its own unique atmosphere and offers something different for diners.

The perfect place to start the day is The Grind Coffee Shop serving not just incredible coffee, but decadent baked goods.

Pinwheel Garden is a great spot for lunch or dinner. The restaurant has a garden-like setting with an outdoor patio that's perfect for enjoying a meal on a nice day. The menu features a variety of fresh, healthy, and delicious options, making it a great choice for those looking for a healthy meal.

Mordi's Sandwich Shop is a popular lunch spot for locals and visitors alik

name: Apartment in Jersey City w/ Private Parking!
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City is a vibrant and bustling neighborhood known for its accessibility to NYC!

The Riverview Fisk Park is just a 10 minute walk away, offering breathtaking views of the Manhattan skyline. Other parks include Pershing Field, which has a community pool and tennis courts as well as the Leonard Gordon Park for amazing sunset views.

There are many convenience stores just a block away, as well as a Stop and Shop and Walgreens for your grocery and pharmacy needs.

You’ll find everything you need at Central Avenue, just a 10 minute walk away, which holds many restaurants, cafes and bakeries as well as discount stores and farmers markets.

The street is in the Bergen-Lafayette area of Jersey City and is up and coming. Berry Lane park with its basketball and tennis courts is a five minute walk away. It is the one of the biggest recreational parks in Jersey City. There's also a baseball field and a football pitch, where you can watch people say soccer, rugby and football all through the week.

Liberty State park is also a 15 to 25 minute leisurely walk away from my house.

To find out what is going on in New York City the week you're traveling you can look up Time Out NYC and New York Adventure Club.

neighborhood_overview:
Nestled in a charming residential neighborhood, our luxurious 2-bedroom escape offers an ideal location for travelers seeking both tranquility and urban convenience. Designed for travelers without a vehicle, our haven is a short 6-minute stroll from the Journal Square PATH station, granting you quick access to midtown or downtown NYC in under 30 minutes door to door.

name: Mid-century modern bedroom [2B][25 mins to NYC!]
neighborhood_overview:
Conveniently located, our apartment offers easy access to the vibrant city of New York. The PATH train is just a 15-minute walk or a quick 5-minute Uber ride away, providing a hassle-free commute to iconic destinations such as the World Trade Center (only 25 minutes away) and the Empire State Building (just 35 minutes away). After a day of exploring, return to the comfort of your private room and relax in tranquility.

Nestled in the charming Hamilton Park neighborhood of Jersey City, our apartment allows you to experience the best of both worlds. Enjoy the peacefulness of tree-lined streets and the beauty of Hamilton Park, known for its historical significance and well-maintained green spaces. This family-friendly neighborhood offers a variety of dining options, cozy cafes, and boutique shops to explore. With its close proximity to Manhattan, you'll have the opportunity to immerse yourself in the bustling city life while enjoying the laid-back atmosphere of Hamilton Park.

name: The Palisade Penthouse - Minutes to NYC
neighborhood_overview: The Heights overlooks Hoboken from the Palisades, and because Hoboken is a historic district with height restrictions there are no high rises affording the Heights protected NYC views. Central Avenue and Palisade Avenue boast immaculate Manhattan skyline and Hudson River vistas.Jersey City Heights exudes a vibrant yet almost cozy ambiance, blending bustling city energy with a welcoming community spirit. It's a diverse and inclusive neighborhood where local businesses thrive, accompanied by green spaces that offer a refreshing retreat from the city's hustle and bustle. Our city views are unrivaled, thanks to the unique advantage of elevated heights that provide an unmatched vantage point to overlook and embrace the entire cityscape.

name: Chic & Modern | 35 Mins to NYC | Extended Stays
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled along the picturesque shores of the Hudson River, Jersey City, NJ, stands as a vibrant and dynamic destination, offering a unique blend of urban energy and community charm. Just a stone's throw away from the iconic skyline of Manhattan, Jersey City boasts a personality all its own.

Cityscape:
The cityscape is a mosaic of architectural wonders, from historic brownstones to sleek modern skyscrapers. Take a stroll along the waterfront for breathtaking views of the Manhattan skyline, or wander through diverse neighborhoods each with its own character and cultural flair.

Cultural Melting Pot:
Jersey City proudly embraces its cultural diversity, creating a melting pot of flavors, traditions, and artistic expressions. Explore the diverse culinary scene, where global cuisines converge in a gastronomic celebration. The vibrant arts scene reflects the city's creative spirit, with galleries, performances, and street art adding color to the urban landscape.<

name: Luxe 3BR/2BA | NYC Escape | Near Iconic Skyline
neighborhood_overview:
Discover the Best of Jersey City & NYC From Your Perfect Urban Retreat

Nestled in the heart of Jersey City, our stylish and cozy Airbnb offers the perfect balance of urban excitement and serene retreat. Whether you're a solo traveler, couple, or small family, our space is designed to be your ultimate home away from home, with unbeatable access to the vibrant energy of New York City and the hidden gems of Jersey City.

From world-class dining and breathtaking waterfront views to cultural hotspots and effortless transportation, you'll find everything you need just minutes from your doorstep.

Neighborhood Highlights

✨ Waterfront Walkway & Skyline Views
Stroll along the scenic Hudson River Waterfront Walkway, where you'll be mesmerized by unparalleled views of the Manhattan skyline. Whether you're enjoying a peaceful morning walk or capturing a breathtaking sunset, this is one of the most picture-worthy spots in the city.

neighborhood_overview: The Hamilton Park neighborhood is in the heart of downtown Jersey City. It's known for its historical brownstones and incredible restaurants, convenient shopping, and nightlife. This apartment sits directly on the park and is a 10-15 minute walk to either the Newport or Grove Street Path Trains. You can also catch the bus to midtown NYC across the street or take a relaxing ferry ride. The area is located close to the JC waterfront and a 10 minute walk to the Newport Center Mall.

neighborhood_overview:

Street parking is generally hassle-free, with visitor permits required Mon. - Fri. No parking on Thursdays (1pm - 3pm) for street cleaning, but no permits are needed on weekends/holidays. We can provide visitor digital permits for $10/day, with no personal information required, only your car's details.

This area is a perfect blend of old and new, with modern architecture and historic brick buildings coexisting seamlessly. The energy here is contagious, but at the same time calmer than downtown areas.

At the heart of the neighborhood, the intersection of John F. Kennedy Boulevard and Newark Avenue is abuzz with activity. There is an endless variety of restaurants, shops, and other businesses to explore, and the residents love the lively atmosphere.

One of the cultural gems of the neighborhood is the renowned Mana Contemporary Art Center. This awe-inspiring center is housed in a renovated old brick industrial building and offers exciting contemporary art exhibits and shows.

Visitors to New York City will find that Jersey City not only offers more reasonably-priced accommodations with easy access to the Big Apple, but also noteworthy parks, restaurants, bars and other attractions that will make for a fun and memorable trip.

name: Elegant Condo: Right Outside of Manhattan
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to Our Vibrant Jersey City Neighborhood!

Discover Urban Comfort & Excitement:

Nestled in Jersey City's heart, our Airbnb blends city allure with cozy tranquility. Step into a lively area brimming with diverse restaurants, cafes, and local shops, offering a taste of Jersey City's cultural tapestry.

Perfect Urban Hub:

Our central spot ensures you're always at the heart of the action. Delight in diverse cuisines at nearby eateries, explore local art scenes, or savor leisurely walks through scenic parks.

Gateway to Adventures:

Just a 15 minute drive to downtown Manhattan, dive into iconic landmarks and Broadway shows. Retreat to our peaceful neighborhood after a day's city immersion.

Nearby Gems:

Only a 10 minute drive away lies the American Dream Mall, the second largest mall in the United States; a haven for shopping, dining, and entertainment galore—all under one roof.

Cozy Retreat

name: 1BR Cozy Stay w/2Full Beds/Fast Wi-Fi/15min To NYC
neighborhood_overview:
🏙️ Prime Location:

Nestled in the heart of Jersey City, this neighborhood perfectly blends urban energy with residential comfort.

Just minutes from Manhattan, it offers easy access to the city’s vibrant life while maintaining a peaceful and relaxed atmosphere.

🌆 Views and Atmosphere:

Located on the iconic JFK Boulevard, surrounded by a mix of classic and modern architecture.

Enjoy a safe and friendly neighborhood, ideal for exploring on foot or using public transportation.

🍴 Local Food Scene:

A wide variety of restaurants just steps away, from authentic Latin and Asian cuisine to classic diners and cozy cafes.

Nearby recommendations: Rumba Cubana (authentic Cuban food), Miss America Diner (classic American dishes), and Dulce de Leche Bakery for sweet treats.

🌳 Parks and Recreation:

Close to Lincoln Park, a large green space perfect for walking, jogging, or outdoor activities.

name: Luxury 1 bed apt in Jersey City Hudson riverfront
neighborhood_overview:
Why stay in Manhattan when you can savor the peace and quiet of this luxurious Jersey City high-rise? Away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and Fifth Avenue, this Downtown Jersey City building is a better value than anything you’d find across the Hudson - and you can still get to NYC in minutes via the ferry or the PATH train.

Rest and relax in this peaceful oasis perched on the edge of the river, which features plush mattresses, sophisticated wood furnishings, and spacious closets so you can unpack and stay for a while. In the bathroom, you’ll find masterful tile work and modern fixtures - plus towels and toiletries provided for your convenience.

name: NEW LOFT NYC View! Minutes to Manhattan w/ Parking
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights, often referred to simply as "The Heights," is a vibrant neighborhood in Jersey City, New Jersey. Perched atop the New Jersey Palisades, it offers stunning views of the Manhattan skyline and the Hudson River.

Originally an independent municipality known as Hudson City, it merged with Jersey City in 1869. The area is known for its stately Victorian and Edwardian homes, particularly along Summit Avenue and Sherman Place. Pershing Field Park, located in the center of the district, offers green spaces, baseball fields, and other recreation amenities. The adjacent Jersey City Reservoir No. 3 is a designated wetland and park.

Central Avenue serves as the main shopping district with over 240 businesses, contributing to the neighborhood's small-town feel.

The area is well-connected with various transportation options, including the Hudson-Bergen Light Rail, which makes commuting to Manhattan convenient.

name: Huge 3BR Urban Gem - 3 miles to NYC + Free Parking
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood offers the ultimate in convenience for city explorers. Located just three miles from the tunnel into Manhattan, we’re perfectly situated with a bus stop right across the street, a light rail station two blocks away, and the New Jersey Turnpike nearby. Groceries, supermarkets, and other essentials are just steps away, making it easy to settle in and focus on enjoying your trip.

This is a true city neighborhood, full of life and character. You’ll find a diverse mix of people, reflecting the vibrant energy of a community in transition. If you’re looking for a polished, suburban feel, this might not be the best fit. However, if you appreciate the authenticity of an urban environment, with all the quirks and energy that come with it, you’ll feel right at home.

name: Fresh 2 bed 1 bath apt parking W/D, 20 min to NYC!
neighborhood_overview:

name: 2BR Brownstone by Grove St PATH~20 min to NYC
neighborhood_overview:
Brimming with historic charm, cute local boutiques, coffee shops and restaurants stretched along walkable, tree-shaded streets, Hamilton Park historic district contains buildings dating as far back as the Civil War, and many of its homes are historic brick row houses and brownstones with wide, sweeping front steps leading to wooden doors with intricately carved detailing curving over doors, windows and along rooflines.

One of the key reasons residents adore Hamilton Park is the abundance of amenities it offers. The centerpiece of the area, Hamilton Park, provides a lush green space where you can enjoy picnics, play sports, or simply relax under the shade of majestic trees. In addition to the park, Pavonia Avenue hosts a diverse array of restaurants, cafes, and shops, catering to various tastes and interests. From trendy brunch spots to charming boutiques, there is no shortage of things to do and explore in this vibrant neighborhood.

name: Wegman Place
neighborhood_overview:
Walkable and well-connected: Claremont boasts a high walk score, meaning you can get to many errands and destinations on foot. The neighborhood is also conveniently located near the Hudson-Bergen Light Rail, which can whisk you downtown in minutes.

Up-and-coming vibe: Claremont is a neighborhood on the rise. You'll find a mix of residential streets with historic homes and new developments offering modern apartments. There's also a growing restaurant scene on nearby West Side Avenue.

Easy access to green spaces: Take a break from the city life at nearby Liberty State Park or venture a little further to the expansive greenery of Audubon Park.

Here are some things to consider as well:

Limited grocery options: While there are some smaller shops for essentials, there aren't any major supermarkets within walking distance. However, a Light Rail ride can bring you to larger grocery stores downtown.

name: Trendy and Tranquil Near NYC
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled in a serene neighborhood in Jersey City, this studio combines the convenience of city living with the tranquility of suburban charm. A short walk from the property brings you to bustling local hotspots, including international eateries, cozy cafes, and unique shops that showcase the area’s cultural diversity and creativity.

For outdoor enthusiasts, nearby Lincoln Park provides lush green spaces, scenic walking trails, and sports facilities—perfect for relaxing or staying active. Just a bit further, Liberty State Park offers breathtaking views of the Statue of Liberty and Manhattan skyline, making it a must-visit destination for both locals and visitors.

Transportation couldn’t be easier. The Journal Square PATH station, only a 5-minute walk from the property, provides quick and seamless access to Manhattan in about 20 minutes. Whether you’re commuting for work or heading into the city for entertainment, the convenient location ensures stress-free travel.

name: Cozy Jersey City/NYC Oasis w/ Double Balcony
neighborhood_overview:
The Journal Square & McGinley Square neighborhoods of Jersey City offer a perfect blend of urban convenience and local charm.

Just a short 5-10 minute walk away, you'll find a variety of attractions and amenities that will make your stay enjoyable and memorable. From the lively streets of Journal Square to the serene paths of Lincoln Park, there's something for everyone.

Enjoy easy access to the PATH train, making your commute to NYC a breeze. Experience the local flavors, unique shopping experiences, and the warm community spirit that defines this neighborhood.

See below for some local favorites

Best Pizza:
Razza Pizza Artigianale (275 Grove St): A must-visit for pizza lovers, known for its delicious, wood-fired pies made with fresh, local ingredients.

Best Margarita:
Orale Mexican Kitchen (341 Grove St): Enjoy a fantastic margarita in a lively atmosphere with an extensive menu of Mexican dishes.

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights is a lively and safe neighborhood located in Jersey City, New Jersey, just across the Hudson River from Manhattan. Known for its vibrant atmosphere and scenic views, it has become a popular destination for residents and visitors alike.

One of the defining features of Jersey City Heights is its elevated location, which provides breathtaking panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline and the Hudson River. Residents and visitors can enjoy stunning vistas from various vantage points throughout the neighborhood, offering a unique perspective on the iconic New York City skyline.

The area offers a wide range of culinary options. From cozy cafes to trendy restaurants, you'll find an array of cuisines to satisfy your palate.

Brimming with historic charm, cute local boutiques, coffee shops and restaurants stretched along walkable, tree-shaded streets, Hamilton Park historic district contains buildings dating as far back as the Civil War, and many of its homes are historic brick row houses and brownstones with wide, sweeping front steps leading to wooden doors with intricately carved detailing curving over doors, windows and along rooflines.

One of the key reasons residents adore Hamilton Park is the abundance of amenities it offers. The centerpiece of the area, Hamilton Park, provides a lush green space where you can enjoy picnics, play sports, or simply relax under the shade of majestic trees. In addition to the park, Pavonia Avenue hosts a diverse array of restaurants, cafes, and shops, catering to various tastes and interests. From trendy brunch spots to charming boutiques, there is no shortage of things to do and explore in this vibrant neighborhood.

name: WOW Brownstone w/ Outdoor Space
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights, often referred to simply as "The Heights," is a vibrant neighborhood in Jersey City, New Jersey. Perched atop the New Jersey Palisades, it offers stunning views of the Manhattan skyline and the Hudson River.

Originally an independent municipality known as Hudson City, it merged with Jersey City in 1869. The area is known for its stately Victorian and Edwardian homes, particularly along Summit Avenue and Sherman Place. Pershing Field Park, located in the center of the district, offers green spaces, baseball fields, and other recreation amenities. The adjacent Jersey City Reservoir No. 3 is a designated wetland and park.

Central Avenue serves as the main shopping district with over 240 businesses, contributing to the neighborhood's small-town feel.

The area is well-connected with various transportation options, including the Hudson-Bergen Light Rail, which makes commuting to Manhattan convenient.

Need to get your NYC fix? The Grove St PATH Station is just a 10-minute walk through some super cute, chill residential streets!

NEIGHBORHOOD OVERVIEW

Situated along the Hackensack River, Jersey City's West Side neighborhood offers everything you could want in a community: fantastic local shops and restaurants, highly-rated schools, nearby universities, comprehensive mass transit, walkable streets, and the expansive 273-acre Lincoln Park on the river.

From the West Side, you can easily reach all parts of Jersey City, Newark, and New York City using buses and trains. This neighborhood is conveniently close to Journal Square, a major transportation hub in the city. Saint Peter's University is nearby, with Rutgers University also within reach. The West Side area features some of Jersey City's best dining experiences and amenities, making it a quiet, urban enclave within a bustling city.

Bergen-Lafayette in Jersey City is a vibrant neighborhood that offers a unique blend of history, culture, and modern development. Known for its rich historical background, the neighborhood's roots trace back to the 17th century when it was part of the original Bergen Township. Today, it’s a flourishing residential area that combines historic charm with modern convenience. It has a peaceful, community-driven atmosphere and close to downtown Jersey City and New York City via public transportation​
.

For those who love green spaces, Bergen-Lafayette doesn’t disappoint. It’s home to some of the largest parks in Jersey City, including Berry Lane Park, which features basketball courts, a skate park, and more. Jersey City Heights is a lively and safe neighborhood located in Jersey City, New Jersey, just across the Hudson River from Manhattan. Known for its vibrant atmosphere and scenic views, it has become a popular destination for residents and visitors alike.

One of the defining features of Jersey City Heights is its elevated location, which provides breathtaking panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline and the Hudson River. Residents and visitors can enjoy stunning vistas from various vantage points throughout the neighborhood, offering a unique perspective on the iconic New York City skyline.

The area offers a wide range of culinary options. From cozy cafes to trendy restaurants, you'll find an array of cuisines to satisfy your palate.

name: Exquisite Suite 10 min from NYC w. Garage Parking
neighborhood_overview: We’re located in the Heights neighborhood of Jersey City, an exciting and up-and-coming area that offers a dynamic blend of culture, convenience, and character. The Heights is known for its vibrant community, stunning views of the Manhattan skyline, and proximity to bustling downtown Jersey City and Hoboken. While our neighborhood may not feature classic brownstones or high-end boutiques, it boasts a rich urban charm, local eateries, and parks that create a welcoming atmosphere for residents and visitors alike. Whether you're exploring nearby Riverview-Fisk Park or enjoying the lively community events, the Heights provides an authentic city experience while being just minutes away from the heart of New York City.

With several bus stops just a stone's throw away, the possibilities for adventure are endless. Come stay with us and experience the perfect blend of comfort and accessibility!

neighborhood_overview:
Journal Square is a vibrant and bustling neighborhood, known for its central transportation hub and rich cultural heritage.

At the heart of Journal Square is the Journal Square Transportation Center, a major transportation hub connecting various forms of transit, including buses, trains, and PATH (Port Authority Trans-Hudson) trains. This central location makes it a convenient hub for commuting to New York City and other parts of New Jersey, attracting a diverse range of residents and visitors.
Journal Square is a melting pot of cultures, offering a vibrant tapestry of ethnic diversity. This is reflected in the variety of cuisines, shops, and markets found throughout the neighborhood. From Indian and Middle Eastern eateries to Latin American and Caribbean flavors, there is no shortage of culinary delights to explore. You can also find an array of local shops, markets, and specialty stores that cater to diverse tastes and preferences.

name: 25min from NYC! |Luxe Suite | 3 TVs
neighborhood_overview:
Nearby Attractions:

Liberty State Park: A mere 10-minute walk away, this expansive urban park offers stunning views of the Manhattan skyline, open green spaces, and access to the Liberty Science Center.

Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island: Catch a ferry from Liberty State Park to visit these iconic landmarks and delve into America's rich history of immigration.

Liberty Science Center: Engage with interactive exhibits and enjoy the largest planetarium in the Western Hemisphere at this renowned science museum, located within Liberty State Park.

Exchange Place: Approximately 1.5 miles away, this bustling district features high-rise buildings, dining options, and the historic Katyń Memorial.

Newport Centre Mall: A short drive or light rail ride takes you to this shopping haven, offering a wide range of retail stores and dining establishments.

name: Free MTA Card for March! 2-bed - 20 mins to NYC!
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City’s historic downtown is brimming with charm, from its cobblestone streets to its eclectic mix of cafes, boutiques, and restaurants. The neighborhood is filled with restaurants, bars, and shops within a few blocks from the apartment! Newark Ave, a pedestrian-only walking street, is filled with restaurants, bars, and shops. 3 blocks away is Van Vorst Park, with lawns, playgrounds, a gazebo, and the occasional farmers market. Liberty State Park, with its breathtaking views of the Statue of Liberty and NYC skyline, is also nearby.

The Grove St PATH Station for the train into NYC is about a 15 minute walk through cute residential streets.

Local Businesses: The Heights has a growing number of small businesses, including restaurants, cafes, boutiques, and galleries. Residents can find a variety of dining options, from traditional to international cuisine.

name: Newly Renovated Cozy 3BR near NYC!
neighborhood_overview:
West Side, Jersey City

Experience the charm of Jersey City’s West Side, a vibrant and diverse neighborhood with a welcoming local feel. Centered around West Side Avenue, one of the area’s main shopping streets, this district offers a mix of boutiques, cafés, and essential conveniences. Just west of Kennedy Boulevard, the avenue is a key thoroughfare, making it easy to explore the city.

A highlight of the neighborhood is Lincoln Park, one of Hudson County’s largest and most scenic green spaces. Whether you’re in the mood for a morning jog, a game of tennis, or a relaxing picnic, the park has something for everyone. With biking trails, athletic fields, and even a golf range, it’s the perfect spot to unwind and enjoy the outdoors.

West Side offers a balance of urban accessibility and suburban tranquility, making it an ideal stay for visitors looking to experience the best of Jersey City.

neighborhood_overview:
ersey City Heights, often simply called The Heights, is a pleasant, somewhat densely packed residential neighborhood in the northern section of Jersey City, which in turn is the second-largest city in the state of New Jersey.

Homes in the area can be most often found in the two- and three-family detached houses which sit on small lots and which dominate the housing stock here, or in the low-rise apartment buildings that also are a considerable presence in the neighborhood. There are also more than a few stately old Victorian and Edwardian houses scattered throughout the streets of the Heights with rental apartments within, especially on Sherman Place and Summit Avenue.

name: Free Parking! Huge 3BR near NYC-15min Times Square
neighborhood_overview:
Located in the heart of Jersey City Heights, this apartment offers the perfect blend of quiet residential living and easy access to NYC's excitement. Just blocks from vibrant Central Avenue's diverse restaurants and shops, and minutes from Hoboken's bustling Washington Street. The Manhattan skyline views from Riverview-Fisk Park (6 min walk) are breathtaking!

Transportation is a breeze with the 87/84 bus stop right across the street, taking you directly to Port Authority Bus Terminal in 20 minutes. For train lovers, Congress Street Light Rail station is a short walk away, connecting you to Exchange Place PATH and NYC-bound ferries.

Local Favorites Within Walking Distance:
Best Pizza: Rizzo's Pizza (Central Ave) - Classic NY-style slices and pies
Best Coffee: Modcup Coffee (Palisade Ave) - Specialty coffee with skyline views
Best Bagels: Wonder Bagels (Central Ave) - Fresh, authentic NJ bagels
Best Park Views: Riverview-Fisk Park - Manhattan sky
